summary: Using hellstrom102's wallpaper randomizer and mesh mod for the main menu, Wallrim adds 201 wallpapers randomly presented at the start of the game!
descriptionHtml:
[u][size=3][b]Description:[/b][/size][/u]

I love the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/3708/?]wallpaper replacer and randomizer[/url] created by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/1535027/?]hellstrom102[/url], but I was kind of disappointed with most images selected. At the same time, I love the first wallpaper he provides and so I decided to explore that layout by changing the image on it.

Therefore, I've come up with 201 wallpapers using the same layout. Each of them has its own folder and they can be easily erased if it doesn't fit your taste. It uses [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/1535027/?]hellstrom102[/url] randomizer to make all images random every time you start the game. It's a combination of ingame wallpapers and artwork made by artists inside and outside the community.

[b][u][size=3]Installation:[/size][/u][/b]

[list=1][*][size=2]Via MO or NMM or manually, the archives have the proper folder structure.[/size]
[*][size=2]Tastes vary and if there is any wallpaper that you don't like you can simply erase the folder where it is located (the whole folder - that is - if you don't like wallpaper "DF" just erase the whole "DF" folder from [i]mainmenuwallpapers[/i]. [i]Remember that each folder you erase makes that wallpaper vanish from the selection of wallpapers presented in the game's main menu. [/i]To avoid going through all the folders in search of those you don't like, I've uploaded all the wallpapers into the images section with their name folder on them, you can easily find them that way instead. *SPOILER ALERT*[/size][/*]
[/list]
[size=3][b][u]Optional Files:[/u][/b][/size]

[list]
[*][size=2]Fog Remover[/size]
[*][size=2]Bethesda Logo Remover[/size]
[/list]
Just download and install with your mod manager or manually.

[b][u][size=3]Uninstallation:[/size][/u][/b]

If using mod manager, simply uninstall it. Be sure to check Data folder and see if the [i]mainmenuwallpapers[/i] is not there. It it is, delete it.
-OR-
Manually erase the [i]mainmenuwallpapers[/i] folder in your data folder and the file rmm_plugin.dll in "/Data/SKSE/Plugins" folder.

[b][u][size=3]Credits

[/size][/u][/b]This collection of wallpapers wouldn't be possible without the wonderful mod created by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/1535027/?]hellstrom102[/url].
Credits also go to several artists in the DeviantART community such as leventep, ninjatic, jjpeabody and AndreeWallin

All the other images used were gathered here in the Nexus (thanks to all the users that uploaded their screenshots, I've used a lot of them. I'm sorry but I did not keep track of who uploaded what!)

I hope you enjoy this as much as I do as it gives a fresh intro every time!

[size=3][b][u]Suggestions

[/u][/b][/size][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/2101/?]Dragonborn Comes music replacement[/url] performed by Malukah and uploaded to Nexus with her permission by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/3286776]NodusCursorius[/url]. Adds great atmosphere and it's my all-time favourite song of Skyrim!
author: Boltstrap
